aima.core.probability

Interface Factor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProbabilityTable

    public interface Factor
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 524.

    Each factor is a matrix indexed by its argument variables.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Factor.Iterator
      Interface to be implemented by an object/algorithm that wishes to iterate over the possible assignments for the random variables comprising this Factor.

      Pointwise multiplication of this Factor by a given multiplier, creating a new Factor representing the product of the two.

      see: AIMA3e Figure 14.10 page 527.

      Note: Default Factor multiplication is not commutative.

      Pointwise Multiplication - Product Order Specified (POS).

      see: AIMA3e Figure 14.10 page 527.

      Pointwise multiplication of this Factor by a given multiplier, creating a new Factor representing the product of the two.
      Factor sumOut(RandomVariable... vars)
      Sum out the provided variables from this Factor creating a new Factor of the remaining variables with their values updated with the summed out random variables.

      see: AIMA3e page 527.

    • Method Detail

      • getArgumentVariables

        java.util.Set<RandomVariable> getArgumentVariables()
        Returns:
        a consistent ordered Set (e.g. LinkedHashSet) of the argument variables for this Factor.

      • contains

        boolean contains(RandomVariable rv)
        Parameters:
        rv - the Random Variable to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if this Factor contains the passed in Random Variable, false otherwise.

      • getValues

        double[] getValues()
        Note: Do not modify the double[] returned by this method directly as it is intended to be read only.
        Returns:
        the double[] used to represent the Factor.

      • sumOut

        Factor sumOut(RandomVariable... vars)
        Sum out the provided variables from this Factor creating a new Factor of the remaining variables with their values updated with the summed out random variables.

        see: AIMA3e page 527.

        Parameters:
        vars - the random variables to sum out.
        Returns:
        a new Factor containing any remaining random variables not summed out and a new set of values updated with the summed out values.

      • pointwiseProduct

        Factor pointwiseProduct(Factor multiplier)
        Pointwise multiplication of this Factor by a given multiplier, creating a new Factor representing the product of the two.

        see: AIMA3e Figure 14.10 page 527.

        Note: Default Factor multiplication is not commutative. The reason is because the order of the variables comprising a Factor dictate the ordering of the values for that factor. The default order of the variables of the Factor returned is the order of the variables as they are seen, as read from the left to right term, for e.g.:

        f1(Y)f2(X, Y)

        would give a Factor of the following form:
        Y, X

        i.e. an ordered union of the variables from the two factors.
        To override the default order of the product use pointwiseProductPOS().
        Parameters:
        multiplier -
        Returns:
        a new Factor representing the pointwise product of this and the passed in multiplier. The order of the variables comprising the product factor is the ordered union of the left term (this) and the right term (multiplier).
        See Also:
        pointwiseProductPOS(Factor, RandomVariable...)

      • pointwiseProductPOS

        Factor pointwiseProductPOS(Factor multiplier,
                         RandomVariable... prodVarOrder)
        Pointwise Multiplication - Product Order Specified (POS).

        see: AIMA3e Figure 14.10 page 527.

        Pointwise multiplication of this Factor by a given multiplier, creating a new Factor representing the product of the two. The order of the variables comprising the product will match those specified.
        Parameters:
        multiplier -
        prodVarOrder - the order the variables comprising the product are to be in.
        Returns:
        a new Factor representing the pointwise product of this and the passed in multiplier. The order of the variables comprising the product distribution is the order specified.
        See Also:
        pointwiseProduct(Factor)

      • iterateOver

        void iterateOver(Factor.Iterator fi)
        Iterate over all the possible value assignments for the Random Variables comprising this Factor.
        Parameters:
        fi - the Factor Iterator to iterate.

      • iterateOver

        void iterateOver(Factor.Iterator fi,
               AssignmentProposition... fixedValues)
        Iterate over all possible values assignments for the Random Variables comprising this Factor that are not in the fixed set of values. This allows you to iterate over a subset of possible combinations.
        Parameters:
        fi - the Factor Iterator to iterate
        fixedValues - Fixed values for a subset of the Random Variables comprising this Factor.
